DOC.brief_summary: The objective study evaluate effect supplementary antioxidant therapy level biomarkers inflamatory citocines patient previous history non-melanoma skin cancer treat surgery . This double-blind , randomize , placebo-controlled trial . Patients randomize two group , one receiving placebo ( n=34 ) receive supplementary antioxidant therapy ( n=26 ) vitamin C ( 50 mg ) , vitamin E ( 60 mg ) , zinc ( 40 mg ) 60 day . Blood sample obtain patient , level oxidative stress biomarkers , include 8-isoprostane , nitrite , thiobarbituric acid reactive substance , total antioxidant capacity , measure , well inflamatory citocines ( IL-1 , IL-6 , IL-10 , TNF alfa ) evaluate two different time : ( 1 ) one day start supplementation placebo administration ( 2 ) 60 day intervention . Statistical analysis perform SAS System Windows 9.3 program data analyze use ANOVA repeat measure test .
DOC.brief_title: VITAMIN E , C ZINC IN PATIENTS WITH SKIN CANCER : INFLUENCE ON OXIDATIVE STRESS AND INFLAMMATORY STATE
